org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode

Class CacheManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.CacheManager

  • @InterfaceAudience.LimitedPrivate(value="HDFS")
public final class CacheManager
extends Object
    The Cache Manager handles caching on DataNodes. This class is instantiated by the FSNamesystem. It maintains the mapping of cached blocks to datanodes via processing datanode cache reports. Based on these reports and addition and removal of caching directives, we will schedule caching and uncaching work.

      • directivesById

        private final TreeMap<Long,CacheDirective> directivesById
        Cache directives, sorted by ID. listCacheDirectives relies on the ordering of elements in this map to track what has already been listed by the client.

      • nextDirectiveId

        private long nextDirectiveId
        The directive ID to use for a new directive. IDs always increase, and are never reused.

      • directivesByPath

        private final TreeMap<String,List<CacheDirective>> directivesByPath
        Cache directives, sorted by path

      • validateExpiryTime

        private static long validateExpiryTime(CacheDirectiveInfo info,
                      long maxRelativeExpiryTime)
                                throws org.apache.hadoop.fs.InvalidRequestException
        Calculates the absolute expiry time of the directive from the CacheDirectiveInfo.Expiration. This converts a relative Expiration into an absolute time based on the local clock.
        Parameters:
        info - to validate.
        maxRelativeExpiryTime - of the info's pool.
        Returns:
        the expiration time, or the pool's max absolute expiration if the info's expiration was not set.
        Throws:
        org.apache.hadoop.fs.InvalidRequestException - if the info's Expiration is invalid.

      • checkLimit

        private void checkLimit(CachePool pool,
              String path,
              short replication)
                 throws org.apache.hadoop.fs.InvalidRequestException
        Throws an exception if the CachePool does not have enough capacity to cache the given path at the replication factor.
        Parameters:
        pool - CachePool where the path is being cached
        path - Path that is being cached
        replication - Replication factor of the path
        Throws:
        org.apache.hadoop.fs.InvalidRequestException - if the pool does not have enough capacity

        CacheDirectiveStats describing the needed stats for this path

        Adds a directive, skipping most error checking. This should only be called internally in special scenarios like edit log replay.

      • createFromInfoAndDefaults

        private static CacheDirectiveInfo createFromInfoAndDefaults(CacheDirectiveInfo info,
                                           CacheDirective defaults)
        Factory method that makes a new CacheDirectiveInfo by applying fields in a CacheDirectiveInfo to an existing CacheDirective.
        Parameters:
        info - with some or all fields set.
        defaults - directive providing default values for unset fields in info.
        Returns:
        new CacheDirectiveInfo of the info applied to the defaults.

      • modifyDirectiveFromEditLog

        void modifyDirectiveFromEditLog(CacheDirectiveInfo info)
                          throws org.apache.hadoop.fs.InvalidRequestException
        Modifies a directive, skipping most error checking. This is for careful internal use only. modifyDirective can be non-deterministic since its error checking depends on current system time, which poses a problem for edit log replay.
        Throws:
        org.apache.hadoop.fs.InvalidRequestException
